subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] Written QS notes
msgSnippet: Hey, Chuck, we all make a few little typos!  Nice job, and a very neat hand. I have a question: are you very comfortable with the relatively vertical letters
messageBody:
Message
Hey, Chuck, we all make a few little typos!  Nice job, and a very neat hand.
I have a question: are you very comfortable with the relatively vertical letters -- is that your natural hand in TO, too, or is it from copying Kingsley's letters?  As soon as I began writing in Read (and there are several weeks in my journal in Read) I began to feel the need for a natural slant, and so my own hand looks quite different from yours and Kingsley's.
 
jon
-----Original Message-----
From: Chuck Peck [mailto:chuck091956@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 18, 2004 11:21 AM
To: read_alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Written QS notes

Hello All,
 
After sending out the writing, it was noted to me that I had some typos. Not phonetic errors, just plain old messed up things.
 
I guess this writing will help me as much as anyone else! 
 
One of those errors is that I did not set the "The" adbrevation as a deep charater.
 
The orignal text is:
***********************************************
Mr. Caryll, lately from Rome, stood by the window, looking out
over the rainswept, steaming quays to Notre Dame on the island
yonder.  Overhead rolled and crackled the artillery of an
April thunderstorm, and Mr. Caryll, looking out upon Paris in
her shroud of rain, under her pall of thundercloud, felt
himself at harmony with Nature.  Over his heart, too, the
gloom of storm was lowering, just as in his heart it was still
little more than April time.
***********************************************
 
Have a great day all!
Chuck

Do you Yahoo!?
SBC Yahoo! - Internet access at a great low price.

Hey, Chuck, we all make a few little typos!  Nice job, and a very neat
hand. 
I have a question: are you very comfortable with the relatively vertical
letters -- is that your natural hand in TO, too, or is it from copying
Kingsley's letters?  As soon as I began writing in Read (and there are
several weeks in my journal in Read) I began to feel the need for a
natural slant, and so my own hand looks quite different from yours and
Kingsley's.
 
jon

Hello All,
 
After sending out the writing, it was noted to me that I had some typos.
Not phonetic errors, just plain old messed up things.
 
I guess this writing will help me as much as anyone else!
<http://us.i1.yimg.com/us.yimg.com/i/mesg/tsmileys2/04.gif> 
 
One of those errors is that I did not set the "The" adbrevation as a
deep charater.
 
The orignal text is:
***********************************************
Mr. Caryll, lately from Rome, stood by the window, looking out
over the rainswept, steaming quays to Notre Dame on the island
yonder.  Overhead rolled and crackled the artillery of an
April thunderstorm, and Mr. Caryll, looking out upon Paris in
her shroud of rain, under her pall of thundercloud, felt
himself at harmony with Nature.  Over his heart, too, the
gloom of storm was lowering, just as in his heart it was still
little more than April time.
***********************************************
 
Have a great day all!
Chuck
